thread.title: Gogglebox stars Steph & Dom and The Chasers join Let's Sing and Dance for Comic Relief line-up
thread.title_full: Gogglebox stars Steph & Dom and The Chasers join Let's Sing and Dance for Comic Relief line-up - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Gogglebox stars Steph & Dom and The Chasers join Let's Sing and Dance for Comic Relief line-up

organizations.name: facebook follow us on twitter celebs newsletter follow @mirrortv subscribe

text:
Gogglebox stars Steph & Dom and The Chasers join Let's Sing and Dance for Comic Relief line-up Strictly couple James and Ola Jordan are also competing in the dance competition Share Comments By Hayley Minn 16:55, 16 FEB 2017 TV Steph and Dom Let's Sing and Dance for Comic Relief 's line-up looks like itâ€™s going to be incredible.
It was earlier revealed that Blue 's Duncan James, 5ive's Richie Neville, Pop Idol runner-up Gareth Gates, Phats & Small's Ben Ofoedu and S Club's Jon Lee will create Boys Allowed and perform Girls Aloud hit Biology.
But now, the BBC show has added Gogglebox's Steph and Dom Parker, The Chasers and former Strictly stars James and Ola Jordan to the lineup too.
Steph and Dom will be transforming into legendary duo Meatloaf and Cher for a rendition of Dead Ringer for Love, while James and Ola will take on Meghan Trainor's All About That Bass.
Read More Love Actually gets a sequel as Richard Curtis confirms return of Keira Knightley and Hugh Grant Steph and Dom will take part in Let's Sing and Dance for Comic Relief (Photo: Channel 4) Ola Jordan and James Jordan will perform Meghan Trainor Boys Allowed will form for Comic Relief Meanwhile, Anne Hegerty, Jenny Ryan, Mark Labbett and Shaun Wallace from ITV's The Chase will be performing a musical medley from The Wizard of Oz.
The Governess will be playing the Scarecrow. Iconic.
Elsewhere in the show, Matt Edmondson will become Nicki Minaj.
Astrologer Russell Grant, Coronation Street's Sally Lindsay and Absolutely Fabulous's Harriet Thorpe and Helen Lederer will also be taking part.
Read More Scarlett Moffatt reveals how she got revenge on cruel school bully when they came face-to-face recently Anne Hegerty will be playing the scarecrow (Photo: ITV) There will be three live heats on Saturdays leading up to the all-important live grand finale.
Viewers at home and the judging panel will combine to see who gets through each round, before the viewers alone pick the winner.
Richard Curtis has also lined up a French & Saunders reunion for Comic Relief, as well as the VERY exciting news of a Love Actually sequel.
*Comic Relief for Red Nose Day is on on BBC One on Friday, March 24.
